Incident.Summary: The suspect is prohibited from possessing firearms and was observed possibly armed with a handgun on a previous incident.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
This incident was not captured on body-worn camera.

On June 1, 2023 at approximately 1800 hours, MSP Firearms Enforcement Unit personnel were conducting a Joint Operation with Homeland Security Investigations personnel unrelated to this incident.  While conducting the unrelated surveillance, investigators were in the area of 4831 Jefferson Street, Lanham, Prince George’s County, Maryland. Investigators observed an unidentified black male with long dreadlocks walking around the residence at 4831 Jefferson Street.  He was not observed entering or exiting the residence, but walking in the back-yard area moving items such as crab pots or other materials.  The subject looked towards the parked MSP Surveillance vehicle then went out of view around the side of the residence.  When the subject reappeared, he appeared to have a dark colored semiautomatic handgun with an extended magazine tucked in the back waistband of his pants and he tucked his shirt in so it was visible.  The subject did not take any other action with the firearm or exit the curtilage of the property.  Investigators had to leave the area before making further observations, due to the other active investigation.  Investigators were unable to obtain photographic or video documentation of this incident and at the time of their observations, the suspect’s status regarding firearm possession was unknown.  This information was relayed to me, ST S. DiToto #5416 for further investigation.

    I utilized Maryland Department of Assessment and Taxation, TransUnion TLO, and multiple other law enforcement resources to locate a subject matching the description provided.  I obtained images from the suspects recent booking photograph and 2010 Maryland MVA record photograph.  These were related to MSP and HSI investigators who had personally observed the subject and they each confirmed it was a match for the subject they observed with high confidence.  The subject was identified as Richard Franklin Brown 3rd (B/M, DOB: 11/01/1985).  Brown’s Maryland MVA record showed an address of 4823 Jefferson Street, Lanham, Maryland, which is the property adjacent to 4831 Jefferson Street.  The owners of each residence appear to be relatives of Richard Brown 3rd, however, no direct connection was established.  I utilized multiple resources and determined Brown is prohibited from possessing firearms and ammunition under Maryland Public Safety Article for the following reasons:

     1. Court: Circuit Court for Prince George’s County
         Case #: CT040171B
         Offense: Transport/Wear/Carry Handgun
         Disposition: Guilty
         Disposition Date: 05/24/2004

     2. Court: Circuit Court for Prince George’s County
         Case #: CT110640B
         Offense: Manufacture/Distribute/PWID CDS
         Disposition: Guilty
         Disposition Date: 07/22/2011

     3. Court: District Court for The United States Greenbelt
         Case# GD130051
         Offense: Conspiracy PWID PCP
         Disposition: Guilty
         Disposition Date: 01/13/2014

     I further found a METERS/NCIC hit for a Calvert County Sheriff’s Office warrant for FTA: Paternity – Non-Support (#04P10000080) which is currently active.  I responded to the Prince George’s County Circuit Court on June 7, 2023 and obtained True Test copies of the above captioned cases marked 1 and 2.  Those copies are attached to this report.  In conducting further investigation in Brown, I located a nexus to various locations and persons in the DC, Maryland and Virginia areas.  Through this investigation it was found his Maryland license was last valid in 2012 but he currently had DC License (# 4488172) with an address of 2100 Martin Luther King Jr SE, 100, Washington DC. This address was found to be the Government Office for Mental Health and Substance Abuse Services and not a physical residential location.  A nexus between Brown and the addresses in Lanham could not be directly established.  Brown has no registered vehicle and his Delta Plus ETIX information was last involving only rental vehicles and that information was dated.  Multiple checks were conducted with limited information providing any further leads.  I located a Facebook profile with limited public information showing a profile picture of Brown featuring posts dated from 2019 to 2022.  In the profile or other posted images in 2019 photographs, Brown appeared to be in possible group home residence at an unknown location.  Neither residence on Jefferson Street in Lanham is associated with a group living facility. 

     I then conducted physical checks and surveillance of the two residences located on Jefferson Street, Lanham, Maryland.  I observed vehicles parked in front of or in the driveways of each residence that were associated to the respective owners of each property.  The traffic stop history for those vehicles showed no association to Brown.  Brown’s use of the one address in his expired Maryland MVA record and his appearance at the second address are the only nexus between the two.  Brown otherwise does not show any direct correlation to the address at 4831 Jefferson Street other than his physical presence in the yard.  MSP FEU investigators continued to conduct periods of surveillance at Jefferson Street, however, Brown has yet to be observed any subsequent times.  With the information available, sufficient Probable Cause cannot be established to place Brown within either residence.  His current location is unknown.  There is no known phone number in use by Brown.  At this time contact via knock and Talk at the residences is not conducive to the continuance of this investigation.  I conducted deconfliction through HSI as well as through HIDTA Case Explorer and located no other active cases or investigations involving Brown.  MSP FEU Investigators aided by HSI Investigators will continue to seek further investigative avenues and to conduct periodic checks or surveillance of the Jefferson Street locations.  If Brown is observed/located, the appropriate enforcement action will be determined at that time.  At present, no further investigative leads are available to pursue.  Until a time a lead is obtained, I request this case be suspended. 

Above events occurred in Prince George’s County, Maryland.
